TopicTitle: This thing needs a river or canyon. 237m Booster Bridge.

Articles.Content:
I really loved the game Pontifex, you'd have a fixed budget, a max number of parts and the game would test the bridge after you built it.

So today I built myself a bridge. 428 parts, 707t, 237x20x12.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This bridge is "intelligent". It has a probe core, fuel cell, vernor engines and landing gear. Use hyperedit to land it somewhere, while itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s slowly descending you can use the vernor engines to change the attitude. Retract landing gear after it has settled.

At 46t truck has successfully driven over it!

DonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t forget to enable the fuel cell or the street lights will drain the battery in a minute.

In the editor: first select the offset gizmo, then shift-click on any part, and it will choose the root part. This way you can slide it all the way in or out the SPH.

And yes ... a few gif animations are being uploaded with firing boosters ;-)

Download link

Edited October 12, 2015 by Azimech

Wait... An intelligent bridge? Can you confirm that we will not have any rebellions, revolutions, or apocalypses caused by bridges becoming too smart for their own good? I don't want to wake up late one night to learn that the Brooklyn Bridge has personally come down from New York to Alabama to tear me a new one.
Take a look at this: https://bridgecontest.org/

Take a look at this: https://bridgecontest.org/

Ah west point bridge designer. I remember playing around with the exaggeration effects in middle school. Sweet memories of building a most code breaking bridge yet.

In regards to the post, holy mother of bridges, that part count though. Have you tested how much can the bridge handle? (Load wise)

At least 46 tons with ease. I'll try 60 tons soon.

- - - Updated - - -

Wait... An intelligent bridge? Can you confirm that we will not have any rebellions, revolutions, or apocalypses caused by bridges becoming too smart for their own good? I don't want to wake up late one night to learn that the Brooklyn Bridge has personally come down from New York to Alabama to tear me a new one.

This is KSP ... I cannot guarantee you anything!
KSP needs the Stress graphics that BCS/pontifex has.
Good one, FleshJeb.
Haha, very good. But can it take a Canyonero?
If your bridge can't carry a 2700t Crawler-transporter and the rocket on top of it, then it isn't worth anything !

Ah, but can it successfully clear a randomly spawned ferry under it while supporting two cars on the same road traveling at the same time but in the opposite directions? Time to channel your inner polybridger.
There is a river like 100 km north of the temple. The only river on kerbin

There is a river like 100 km north of the temple. The only river on kerbin

Not exactly.

http://www.kerbalmaps.com/

Oooh! My 1600th post!

You are now on Booster Bridge.

Amazing.
Can't REP you yet (*&^$%$#!) Nice bridge!

Have you considered attempting to use the jr. docking ports to make a drawbridge? If you have seen the space planes people built in stock KSP with the tail able to undock and lift up I think that you could do the same with your bridge.
JacobJHC I had to rep you for this suggestion. And welcome to the forum!
Thanks. But seriosly try to build a drawbridge or make it a Challenge.

Using that "formula" doesn't really give an incentive to build beautiful bridges ;-)

Maybe we should start a challenge, with a spot for beautiful bridges. I'm not sure how that section would be ranked though.
I'll start one after 1.1 arrives. I must point out the longer the bridged space, the harder it becomes, so length and width should have multipliers.
Just keep an eye out for one legged depressed androids guys....
He might talk my bridge into self-destruct.
